title: School Assignment Requests in  Quarter 4, 2023

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: School Assignment Requests in  Quarter 4, 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Anonymized data of all school assignment requests made on behalf of
CPS students with IEPs requiring placement from
October 01, 2023 to December 31, 2023. These records
should include a unique non-identifiable code for the student, the
date their IEP was finalized, the date the school assignment request
was made, the date the school assignment letter was issued, and the
date the student enrolled.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit
The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive
any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me
with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

title: Documents Related to Airport-Based "Stuffie" (Stuffed Clam) Tourism Campaign

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents related to the selection and execution of the "#VisitRhodeIsland" marketing campaign featuring giant stuffed clams ("stuffies") at airports around the United States. This campaign was discussed in the April 18, 2023 Providence Journal article, "RI's latest tourism gambit? A 7-foot stuffie at airports around US. Here's why." (https://www.providencejournal.com/story/news/politics/state/2023/04/18/ris-new-tourism-campaign-includes-giant-stuffie-at-airports-in-us/70115796007/)

Specifically, I am seeking:

-The proposal for the campaign submitted to Commerce RI
-Other campaign proposals that were not selected
-Internal Commerce RI emails discussing the "stuffie" campaign and why it was chosen over others
-Documents -- including receipts and invoices -- that show how the campaign's reported $4.5 million budget was spent
-Any complaints or concerns related to the campaign that Commerce RI has received from the public
-Any other documents related to the section and/or execution of the "stuffie" tourism campaign

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Philip Eil

title: NASA support for 2023 film "Leave the World Behind"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NASA support for 2023 film "Leave the World Behind"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) and the production of the 2023 movie "Leave the World Behind," directed by Sam Esmail and starring Julia Roberts and Ethan Hawke. Former President Barack Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama are among the executive producers on the film, which was made through their Higher Ground Productions company. I request any and all documents pertaining to NASA support for "Leave the World Behind." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of NASA and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Leave the World Behind," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Sheriff training by SanDiego County in a local public park

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to submit a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to obtain information related to a police training exercise that occurred in a public park, as captured in the following Reddit post: [Link to Reddit Post - https://www.reddit.com/r/ThatsInsane/comments/18tq3hm/san_diego_police_caught_training_and_hiding_in_a/?share_id=ONfMZDJ4vrjcenlAW-XRs].

The purpose of this FOIA request is to collect comprehensive information about the training session, including its objectives, instructional content, and any records documenting the details of the exercise.

I kindly request the following information:

The objectives and goals of the police training exercise conducted in the public park, as seen in the provided Reddit post.

Any instructional materials or guidelines provided to the officers participating in the training session.

Records detailing the duration, date, and location of the training exercise.

Information about the agencies or entities involved in organizing and conducting the training session.

Any reports or assessments generated as a result of the training exercise, including feedback and lessons learned.

Any documentation related to the authorization and approval process for conducting such training exercises in a public setting.

I understand the need to redact sensitive information related to national security or ongoing investigations. However, I request that non-sensitive information be provided in accordance with the FOIA guidelines.

Please consider this as a formal request under the Freedom of Information Act. If there are any fees associated with processing this request, please inform me in advance.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. If you have any questions or need further clarification, please feel free to contact me at [Your Phone Number] or [Your Email Address].

Thank you for your assistance in this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mike Davis

title: Winthrop Police Department Roster

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Winthrop Police Department Roster
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Winthrop Police Department roster of all Police Officers, Investigators, Detectives, Police Chief and other personnel who qualify as "law enforcement". That roster should include the first, middle initial and last names of all Winthrop Police Officers currently employed by the Department as the filing of this request. If a Winthrop Police Officer is no longer a Winthrop Police Officer by the time the Winthrop Police Department responds to this request then the records of those formerly employed officers should still be provided. We don't require disciplinary records. We don't require any other identifying information other than the names of all Winthrop Police Officers as of the time of this filing. We do not require the names of auxiliary and non-law enforcement personnel. In other words, we just want a list of names and nothing more.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dion McNeil

communications.subject: Public Information Act Request :: R121481-122823
communications.communication:
Dear Bailey Pillon: 
 
Thank you for your interest in the public records of the Austin Police Department. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 12/28/2023 and given the reference number R121481-122823 for tracking purposes. 
Please be advised that the Austin Police Department’s Central Records Division receives over 2500 requests for information a month. These requests are processed in the order received, and we strive to respond to each request promptly, as required by law. 
Please know that, as a result of the large volume of requests received, the anticipated timeframe for responding to your request may take 10 business days if it is simply an offense report you're requesting.  If you are requesting body cam, dash cam, or other related records your request could take up to 30 days. 
You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records requested. PLEASE NOTE: The Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Austin Public Records Center. 
Austin Police Department

I request all records pertaining to the active shooter situation (including but not limited to CAD report[s] as well as all other documentation, BWC from all officers on scene including SWAT officers as well as non-SWAT officers and [crisis] negotiators [including but not limited to Sgt. Bob Ransom], audio recordings from/to dispatch and so on) on or about January 21st, 2023 at AdventHealth Daytona Beach (address: 301 Memorial Medical Pkwy, Daytona Beach, FL 32117). More specifically, the shooter was identified as then 76 year old Ellen Gilland whom shot and killed her terminally ill 77 year old husband Jerry on the Select Specialty Unit of the hospital. 

I request a fee waiver, as this request is made for news gathering and will be made available free of charge to the public. If a fee waiver cannot be granted, please inform of a estimated time frame and an invoice as to the breakdown (such as by type of documentation, estimated hours and fees for each officer's BWC, and audio recordings to/from dispatch) of the monetary charges, if fees are indeed incurred.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon
